snippet: A cease-fire has been in effect in the rebel areas of eastern Ukraine since September, but severe depopulation is a clear sign that war is once again looming.
abstract: Severe depopulation of much of rebel-held territory in eastern Ukraine is clear sign that despite cease-fire war is looming; roughly 1.5 million people have left, out of a prewar population of about 4.5 million; United Nations figures suggest that about half went to Russia and half to other areas of Ukraine.
lead_paragraph: A cease-fire has been in effect in the rebel areas of eastern Ukraine since September, but severe depopulation is a clear sign that war is once again looming.

headline.main: Nowhere to Run in Eastern Ukraine
headline.print_headline: Nowhere to Run in Eastern Ukraine
